comments.body:
I'd like to pull @willthames and @ryansb into this conversation because I keep noticing purge_tags with different default values. I don't have a preference for whether this should default to true or false but since there's been some backlash over it I think there should be a documented decision so we can get some uniformity. See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/31427#discussion_r147088175.
a) default to False and break backwards compatibility but err on the side of caution
b) default to True and keep compatibility but let users accidentally remove their tags
I think defaulting to `false` is the safest option, and would be consistent with the purge_tags defaults in other modules.

I think the majority do default to false. There are four that definitely do not - ec2_vpc_subnet, elb_target_group, elb_application_lb, and ec2_group all default purge_tags to true. Will those remain an anomaly or can we change the default?
Linking another PR depending on this decision: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/28513#discussion_r139060330

I see - I do prefer having a `true` default, but had it in my head that the default was `false` most places. Since this module doesn't have backwards compatibility requirements, I'm ok with defaulting to `true` as in the guidelines.
